decks.notes: The main concept of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan by utilizing counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. By using cards like Counterspell, Fatal Push, and Force of Negation to control the board, as well as Thought Scour and Unearth for card advantage, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent. Additionally, cards like Kiora, the Rising Tide and Psychic Frog provide additional utility and disruption to keep the opponent on the back foot. Ultimately, the goal is to grind out incremental advantages while preventing the opponent from executing their game plan.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures and powerful burn spells. The deck focuses on aggressive plays and utilizing the synergy between creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah to quickly chip away at the opponent's life total. The inclusion of cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Goblin Bombardment provides additional reach and finishing power, while Static Prison helps to control the board and protect your key creatures. The deck aims to close out games quickly and efficiently through aggressive combat and direct damage spells.

This deck focuses on using aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It also utilizes powerful spells like Lightning Bolt and Tribal Flames to control the board and finish off the opponent. The inclusion of Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding helps to protect your creatures and disrupt the opponent's plans. With Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient aggro strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly play aggressive creatures and cheap spells to deal damage to the opponent as fast as possible. The deck includes a mix of burn spells, pump spells, and creatures with prowess to enable a fast and powerful start. The companion, Jegantha, the Wellspring, provides additional flexibility and value. The mana base is optimized for speed and consistency, allowing the deck to consistently pressure the opponent and win before they can stabilize.

This UR Control deck focuses on countering opponent's spells, disrupting their game plan with card draw and removal spells. The deck includes a mix of counterspells, removal spells, card draw, and threats to control the game's pace and dictate the board state. It aims to control the game through disruption and card advantage, eventually overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures and incremental advantage. The deck's key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's plans while slowly building an advantage through card draw and efficient answers.

The main concept of this UR Control deck is to maintain control over the game through counterspells, removal spells, and powerful card advantage engines like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Snapcaster Mage. By using Subtlety and other control cards, the deck can disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect its own win conditions. The deck aims to control the board state, draw out the game, and eventually overwhelm the opponent with powerful late-game plays like Archmage's Charm and Lórien Revealed while keeping the opponent's threats in check. The deck is designed to outlast and outmaneuver the opponent to secure victory.

The main concept of this Aggro - Affinity deck is to quickly deploy a board full of artifact creatures and use cards like Cranial Plating and Shadowspear to boost their power and toughness. Emry, Lurker of the Loch is used to recur artifacts from the graveyard while Kappa Cannoneer and Thought Monitor provide additional threats. Mishra's Bauble and Metallic Rebuke help control the board while Urza's Saga provides additional artifact synergy. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and aggressive artifact-based strategy.

decks.player: Gonzalo Barron Ruiz De La Cuesta

decks.notes: The main concept of this UR Control deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats with removal spells, and generating card advantage with Tamiyo and Snapcaster Mage. The deck also aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Subtlety and Sink into Stupor. Additionally, the deck has versatile options like Archmage's Charm and Force of Negation to handle a variety of situations. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent until it can win with its threats like Flame of Anor and Thundering Falls.
